sentences.english: Matthew is twenty-seven years old and visually impaired.
sentences.chinese: 馬修是二十七個歲及視障人士。

sentences.english: Some students in the system have multiple disabilities.
sentences.chinese: 這些視障學生當中的一些學生患多重殘疾。

sentences.english: Although he is visually impaired, he did not abandon his dream of becoming a tenor.
sentences.chinese: 視障的他並沒有因此就放棄成爲男高音的夢想。

sentences.english: They will be deaf and blind.
sentences.chinese: 他們將會是聽障和視障人士。

sentences.english: The modern education technology can improve the study adaptable ability of the visually impaired students.
sentences.chinese: 現代教育技術能改善視障學生的學習適應能力。

sentences.english: Participants were impressed by the darkness experience and the professional guidance of visually impaired trainers.
sentences.chinese: 參賽者均難忘全黑的體驗和視障訓練員的專業引導。

definition: disadvantaged social groups (e.g. the handicapped)/the economically and politically marginalized/the dispossessed
Dounan or Tounan town in Yunlin county 雲林縣|云林县[Yun2 lin2 xian4], Taiwan
to fulfill one's dream/(divination) to predict the future by interpreting a dream/oneiromancy
golden years (after the age of about 60)
Jianshi or Chienshih township in Hsinchu County 新竹縣|新竹县[Xin1 zhu2 Xian4], northwest Taiwan
Chinese person who returns to China after living as an expatriate
to visit (a patient, prisoner etc)/to look inquiringly
